intro: Chamaesciadium nodiflorum, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from blue to purple, bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is drought-tolerant and often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
